hdr101606-inequality.def: Inequality in distribution of years of schooling based on data from household surveys estimated using the Atkinson inequality index.
hdr101606-inequality.name: Inequality in education
hdr101606-inequality.source: Calculated based on data from the Luxembourg Income Study database, Eurostatâ€™s European Union Statistics on Income and Living Conditions, the World Bankâ€™s International Income Distribution Database, the Center for Distributive, Labor and Social Studies and the World Bankâ€™s Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean, ICF Macro Demographic and Health Surveys and United Nations Childrenâ€™s Fund Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys using the methodology in Technical note 2.
hdr101606-inequality.dataset: Calculated based on data from the Luxembourg Income Study database, Eurostatâ€™s European Union Statistics on Income and Living Conditions, the World Bankâ€™s International Income Distribution Database, the Center for Distributive, Labor and Social Studies and the World Bankâ€™s Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean, ICF Macro Demographic and Health Surveys and United Nations Childrenâ€™s Fund Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys using the methodology in Technical note 2.

hdr101706-inequality.def: Inequality in income distribution based on data from household surveys estimated using the Atkinson inequality index.
hdr101706-inequality.name: Inequality in income
hdr101706-inequality.source: Calculated based on data from the Luxembourg Income Study database, Eurostatâ€™s European Union Statistics on Income and Living Conditions, the World Bankâ€™s International Income Distribution Database, the Center for Distributive, Labor and Social Studies and the World Bankâ€™s Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean, ICF Macro Demographic and Health Surveys and United Nations Childrenâ€™s Fund Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys using the methodology in Technical note 2.
hdr101706-inequality.dataset: Calculated based on data from the Luxembourg Income Study database, Eurostatâ€™s European Union Statistics on Income and Living Conditions, the World Bankâ€™s International Income Distribution Database, the Center for Distributive, Labor and Social Studies and the World Bankâ€™s Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean, ICF Macro Demographic and Health Surveys and United Nations Childrenâ€™s Fund Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys using the methodology in Technical note 2.

hdr101806-inequality.def: Inequality in distribution of expected length of life based on data from life tables estimated using the Atkinson inequality index.
hdr101806-inequality.name: Inequality in life expectancy
hdr101806-inequality.source: Calculated based on abridged life tables from UNDESA (2019a).
hdr101806-inequality.dataset: Calculated based on abridged life tables from UNDESA (2019a).

hdr135006-inequality.def: Average inequality in three basic dimensions of human development.
hdr135006-inequality.name: Coefficient of human inequality
hdr135006-inequality.source: Calculated as the arithmetic mean of the values in inequality in life expectancy, inequality in education and inequality in income using the methodology in Technical note 2 (available at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf).
hdr135006-inequality.dataset: Calculated as the arithmetic mean of the values in inequality in life expectancy, inequality in education and inequality in income using the methodology in Technical note 2 (available at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr135106-inequality.def: Ratio of the average income of the richest 20 percent of the population to the average income of the poorest 20 percent of the population.
hdr135106-inequality.name: Income inequality, quintile ratio
hdr135106-inequality.source: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2019a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 15 July 2019.
hdr135106-inequality.dataset: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2019a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 15 July 2019.

hdr138806-inequality.def: HDI value adjusted for inequalities in the three basic dimensions of human development. See Technical note 2 at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf for details on how the IHDI is calculated.
hdr138806-inequality.name: Inequality-adjusted HDI
hdr138806-inequality.source: Calculated as the geometric mean of the values in the inequality-adjusted life expectancy index, inequality-adjusted education index and inequality-adjusted income index using the methodology in Technical note 2 (available at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf).
hdr138806-inequality.dataset: Calculated as the geometric mean of the values in the inequality-adjusted life expectancy index, inequality-adjusted education index and inequality-adjusted income index using the methodology in Technical note 2 (available at http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020_technical_notes.pdf).

hdr186106-inequality.def: Share of pre-tax national income held by the richest 1 percent of the population. Pre-tax national income is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labour and capital, before taking into account the  tax/transfer system and after taking into account the pension system.
hdr186106-inequality.name: Income share held by richest 1%
hdr186106-inequality.source: World Inequality Database (2020). World Inequality Database. http://wid.world. Accessed 20 August 2020.
hdr186106-inequality.dataset: World Inequality Database (2020). World Inequality Database. http://wid.world. Accessed 20 August 2020.

hdr186906-inequality.def: Share of national income held by the poorest 40 percent of the population.
hdr186906-inequality.name: Income share held by poorest 40%
hdr186906-inequality.source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
hdr186906-inequality.dataset: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr187006-inequality.def: Share of national income held by the richest 10 percent of the population.
hdr187006-inequality.name: Income share held by richest 10 %
hdr187006-inequality.source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
hdr187006-inequality.dataset: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr67106-inequality.def: Measure of the deviation of the distribution of income among individuals or households within a country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, a value of 100 absolute inequality.
hdr67106-inequality.name: Income inequality, Gini coefficient
hdr67106-inequality.source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
hdr67106-inequality.dataset: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr71406-inequality.def: HDI education index value adjusted for inequality in distribution of years of schooling based on data from household surveys listed in Main data sources.
hdr71406-inequality.name: Inequality-adjusted education index
hdr71406-inequality.source: Calculated based on inequality in education and the HDI education index.
hdr71406-inequality.dataset: Calculated based on inequality in education and the HDI education index.

hdr71506-inequality.def: HDI life expectancy index value adjusted for inequality in distribution of expected length of life based on data from life tables listed in Main data sources.
hdr71506-inequality.name: Inequality-adjusted life expectancy index
hdr71506-inequality.source: Calculated based on inequality in life expectancy and the HDI life expectancy index.
hdr71506-inequality.dataset: Calculated based on inequality in life expectancy and the HDI life expectancy index.

hdr71606-inequality.def: HDI income index value adjusted for inequality in income distribution based on data from household surveys listed in Main data sources.
hdr71606-inequality.name: Inequality-adjusted income index
hdr71606-inequality.source: Calculated based on inequality in income and the HDI income index.
hdr71606-inequality.dataset: Calculated based on inequality in income and the HDI income index.

hdr73506-inequality.def: Percentage difference between the IHDI value and the HDI value.
hdr73506-inequality.name: Overall loss in HDI due to inequality
hdr73506-inequality.source: Calculated based on data in columns 1 and 2.
hdr73506-inequality.dataset: Calculated based on data in columns 1 and 2.
